# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is a function to wrap text into lines based on a given text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        line = line * " " * word
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

It splits the input text into words, then builds up lines by adding words until the maximum text width would be exceeded. At that point it starts a new line. Finally it joins the lines adding newlines between them.

Here is an example of using it:

```julia
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
print(wrap_string(text)) 
```

Outputs:

```
This function
will wrap
words into
lines
```
